one_reviews_text: It was good, many diffrent games.

review_title: At least it was free of charge...
one_reviews_text: Never complain when its free
I open the game then takes like a minute in black screen and it bring you back to the oculus home.
Not as cool carnival games or fun park.Jesusavesouls !

review_title: Tech demo of good quality and fun
one_reviews_text: Don't expect this being a full game. It's a tech demo. But for what it is, it's plenty, especially for free. If you have nVidia cards - enjoy the physics effects! Worth the download.
but fun little software to demo your vr stuff. But there are better ones too.

Very good and fun game. I have no complaints. As said in a previous review, I have an AMD Ryzen 2600 cpu; Nvidia 1060; 16gb of ram and it runs perfectly. So a 1050 or so should run well. The background is a little bit creepy. There is nobody walking around and it’s night, so not recommended for people who fear creepy kinda places like that.
was not fun. had good graphics not the best.

review_title: This was actually more fun than...
one_reviews_text: ...I had expected it to be.  Grandkids love it too, especially the boxing part.
This does a great job away what is was designed to do, showcase the graphics capabilities of your Nvidea video card... but after playing through once you'll probably uninstall and forget about it.
The graphics are very detailed other than that its pretty basic "look you can break things" VR demo
Yes, this game is made by Nvidia, but that doesn't mean my AMD gpu can't run it.  Why does this only support Nvidia?

review_title: Fun little games, worth a few plays
one_reviews_text: liked the archery game the most, very well designed.
Every since the new Oculus software update, my system no longer supports the proper GPU to play this game. Is there anyway to correct this error?

review_title: game don't start, crashes after a few se
one_reviews_text: it crashes after a few seconds,  anybody have a solution? , I have a 1060 card

Requires an NVIDIA graphics card or it won't start. Oculus shouldn't allow arbitrary software locks for software in their store, even if the title is free. It is not clear from the system requirements this title will not run on an AMD graphics card.

My System is baised on AMD W9100 Gfx.

This just BSODS or if i'm v.v. lucky CTDs

HELP!

Using a GTX 1060 is fairly decent, why would you want to turn up the graphics???  Why can't you use a 1070 for Medium?  and whay do you need 2 1080's for maximum???  You only get soo much resolution out of the Oculus and the 1060 is plenty.  Have a party with your friends to see who can have the best scores!  Can't share scores with social :(  Can't Multiplayer :(

This title requires a really strong machine to run so you better put the setting to lowest or you will have extremely low refresh rate and nausea. The game has some amazing physics(especially the goo is extraordinary if you spent some time on it). They are fun and you can also work out(i spent rage time on boxing!). A must have especially if you have kids!
Performs absolutely horribly on my 8700k + 1080ti. Stuttering hands and what not!
Play it!

review_title: Wouldn't start(And I have a NVIDIA card)
one_reviews_text: Game wouldn't load, kept getting errors.
This game was a lesson on how much money I need to spend on Nvidia graphics processors.
SUPERB graphics and interaction but my GTX 970, Intel i5 CPU and 32G RAM memory weren't enough. Uninstalled it because it made me motion sick. This app really taxes your machine.
Could be enjoyable with some kids and competitive spirit

review_title: Very good game to start playing VR
one_reviews_text: A great game to start your way on proffesional VR experience

review_title: A very fun nVidia showcase tool!
one_reviews_text:
This app was clearly designed to showcase nVidia graphics and it definitely shows, the game is incredibly short (Roughly 5 minutes) however the graphics are brilliant especially with the hair and goo effects, you will be installing this either out of curiousity or to showcase to your friends.

Despite the app requirements of a GTX 1060 or higher, my 1050ti (and FX 8350) ran it very smoothly until I entered the settings options and then it crashed, simply avoid the settings and you'll be fine.  There are better carnival games out there but this one is the best looking and it will be for a good, long while.
Very fun experience to entertain your friends and family members
Really good fun, a great one to try out with VR newbies.
A series of minigames meant to demo NVIDIA specific traits. Good for demos, not much else. Surprisingly demanding on a 1070. Good for benchmarking.
I played through this game once and uninstalled. Was it meant to be played multiple times? Has the same appeal as playing with broken glass.
Wow! great graphics and extraordinary physics, best VR quality so far even tho it's just about 10 min. Just hope this kind of quality would be implemented in a AAA-title!

Surprisingly well made. Very high quality. One of the best experiences in VR I had to be honest. I really enjoy the physics. Makes you wonder why other shooters haven't incorporated the same mesh destruction techniques used in this demo. So satisfying and fun.

review_title: Great fun for a free title
one_reviews_text: The graphics are actually better than I expected based on the stills. And whoever programmed this thing needs a medal - some seriously good physics. Would just be a little better if you could walk around the fun fair a little, maybe as a way to get from game to game.

The game consist of a few minigames showing off what virtual reality can be. There are some quite impressive physics interactions. The sword minigame and the glob throwing one stick out as beeing astoundingly immersive. Download this for 20 Mins of good fun.
Just a brilliant showcase of Nvidia Graphic cards abilities.

I gave it a 4 star, because it's a little scary too. Just you alone, no one else, a small fenced off carnival, in the dark. Tell me that, that right there isn't scary enough. The archery distracted me by it but once I got to the boxing game, I started to look around. Almost like a horror movie

Overall enjoyable experience; some activities are fun; while others are a bit dull, mostly due to the controls, and not because of the activity itself. In one instance, you shoot objects flying out of a cannon; but you are too close to the scene and even stepping back does not give much room to aim properly. Much better with the shooting gallery, where you are at the right distance. The best one was archery; where you light up arrows and then fire at targets, some of which moves. It is a fun experience and graphics looks nice, even on a 980; although it is about 6 GB; not sure what is taking so much space, considering that the game won't win any graphics award, nor it last weeks.
I play a number of VR games, and none have given me motion sickness like this one.
its free, high quality... 5 stars.
This is a terrific experience to introduce people to VR.  The controls are simple, it's tons of fun and it looks great if your machine can handle it.
this was an awesome game on my gtx 1080ti i7 6700k to play but ever since an update its always crashes and reports "unreal engine stopped woking"

Some of the games were a blast and easy to get scores on, but in others objects either stuck to my hands and refused to be thrown, or threw about three inches and dropped. I'm no pro, but even I can throw a baseball or basketball harder than that. That said it is fun and you can keep going from game to game. Three stars for the boxing, whacking, and shooting games working extreley well.
Wouldnt run for me :(

Yes I know Nvidia made the game, but Nvidia should not leave out us AMD users just because we have an AMD card. I was actually looking forward to playing this. And BTW my card is the 8GB AMD RX 580 from Gigabyte.
I cannot open the game, I keep getting a error, unistalled it

Really enjoyed this. Looks great and pushes your graphics card to the limit - default is low quality visuals but you can turn this up at the start. Note that it is designed for Nvidia cards and to make the most of it you need something powerful.

The game itself is a collection of fairground minigames, all presented nicely and enjoyable to play. Some are more fun than others but that's to be expected.

YOU NEED SPACE TO SWING YOUR ARMS don't try to play this seated.

Kinda bland selection of mini-games you can play. Was expecting them to be more fun. Graphics settings ingame are nice but are ultimately pointless since you won't be playing this for that long. Overall it's just a GPU VR test app.
It is a good demo for the first time users; I use it a lot to show the Rift to my friends.
i loved it. the best demo ive ever played by far
The game won't start. Every time I launch it, I get a GPU error...

review_title: It does not work because I have an AMD
one_reviews_text: It does not work because I have an AMD RX 480 card. OK but this is a PC ...

tried on both steam and Oculus  but it crashes on launch.
GTX 970
Very well made. Ran great. Fun mini games.

I am giving this 5 stars, it's not a game and don't go in there expecting one, it's a demonstration of things that can be done but it's done so well with so many mini games. punch a mole even feels like a bit of a workout, gather your friends and bring pen and paper, do a round of each mini game and hand the headset to the next person, see who is the carnivaliest! It's really fun, it does exactly what it says it does and it does it very well.

My family and I love this app. It is so much fun. The graphics are pretty cool and you feel like you are at a carnival. We have not figured out the scoring or if we are competing against others that play the game. Also I see no directions but its easy enough for newbies to figure out.
Had a lot of fun with this one even though its on the short side. The bow and arrow game blow me away the first time I played it.

Just to show off some simple VR gaming to include throwing, shooting, punching and bow and arrow. Other than that, not much of a game even though it shows a score at the end. No real way to compete with friends, unless you memorize the scores, it doesn't even keep the high score. It does have differnt graphics levels to show off the hardware capability.

review_title: Very fun game for VR intro
one_reviews_text:
I really enjoyed this more than I thought I would. I like all the interactions objects make with each other. The level transitions are nice. The whole package is very well put together. Fun for kids and adults.

I get a UE4 crash but that's not until closing the game.

review_title: Fun Minigames, but no Replay Value
one_reviews_text: Definitely fun for the time it takes to rotate through the minigames. As far as minigames go, this is a great one to show to people as part of an introduction to Touch, but I wouldn't make it the first one. Global leaderboards would be a fantastic addition to encourage more replay value. My only complaint would be the non-standard gripping controls.
It's still not very fun or a good demo for VR.

Like my title says, it's a nice little demo. Not something you'd spend hours in, unless you're a big, big fan of carnival games. The controls feel a bit wonky but other than that it's a nice demonstration of physics in VR. It runs pretty good on my 1070 and you do get the option of choosing your graphics card (3 options - 1060, 1070, 1080) to set your in-game graphics accordingly from a settings menu.
Pure, comfortable and excellent VR experience. Everyone likes this in our office!!!
Great minigames to introduce VR to kids and family.
Game will not start

review_title: Good free game. Could be a good demo.
one_reviews_text: Nice demo to introduce people to Oculus Rift.
it dosent work it keeps saying that wrong gpu and im not byeing a new gpu this is just to make you by a ninjvida
Great and fun games. Im do wish there was a rotation and center calibration when pressing on the stick, and not just center calibration.

review_title: Doesn't work as well as steam version
one_reviews_text: The oculus store version appears to have serious jitter and low frame rates even on a gtx 1080. The touch haptics also seem to go haywire on some games and constantly vibrate. Other than that the experience itself is really great, and it's a nice demo for first time VR users. If it gets fixed I will come back and review/rate accordingly.

If your computer has the requirements to try this out this is a great glimpse into what can be done in VR.  The thing that blew me away was the little details like the "klinking" of the swords together... it makes the sword feel like it takes up real space... its hard to describe but just that blew me away.  Lots to experiment with on here.  Think of it as a way to test the basics of what we should start to expect in VR games.  Very cool!  And fun!  A blast for the price of free!

This demo is really good, and I could play it only to see the Nvidia Technologies. For all those that are interested in it but who don t have oculus touch, know that you can play it without. It s more limited of course, but it s still kind of enjoyable.

review_title: Cool concept, but using wrong trigger
one_reviews_text: The concept is great, but the execution is completely flawed in that they're using the wrong trigger for grabbing. Whereas everything else on your Touch will use grip trigger, NVIDIA oddly decide to use the *index trigger*...

review_title: I have an Radeon card, can't play.
one_reviews_text: Didn't work on my machine; don't know why.  Giving a 3 star to warn others that it may not work on their Radeon cards.

review_title: Not for AMD-CPU's?? Of course not...
one_reviews_text: the reason could be...it's called "Nvidia Fun House" ..not "AMD Fun House"...just reading.^^
it's like having a free Carnival at your house that you can visit to play games whenever you want. Runs very well on my MSI 970. I will definitely be showing this to demo VR to people
one of the best free games great fun to show to people especially like shooting the targets with arrows and punching using the boxing gloves shooting the crockery
VR Funhouse was a treat to experience. Everyone that I've had try it has had nothing but good things to say. For a free title, it's surprisingly polished. Get it. Play it. Have fun!

It appears to have some slight graphical glitches (GTX 1080) and had some jutter at first, but for the most part, it plays well and it's fun. Plus it's free.

(Star deducted due to slight graphical glitches
Small demos but you can have a lot of fun! Some things don't work for me like the water pistol.

I love it,spend so many hours,never gets bored.
Is free and better than the 'other' carnival game.
Even the low setting(for 1060) doesn't work well on 1070.Frame rate is terrible and always has annoying artifact .
Showcases a lot of what you can do with Touch along with some cool realistic physics. Definitely worth it for free.
i can not even play the game because i have an amd radeon graphics card
very good
Will not attempt to run on an AMD gpu.
Doesn't work with AMD GPUs
